data.title: I Spit on Your Grave will be released in a...
data.meta_description: I Spit on Your Grave will be released in a three-film Collector’s Edition Blu-ray box set on November 11 via Ronin Flix, where it’s exclusively available to pre-order for $59.99. The original I Spit...
data.text:
I Spit on Your Grave will be released in a three-film Collector’s Edition Blu-ray box set on November 11 via Ronin Flix, where it’s exclusively available to pre-order for $59.99.

The original I Spit on Your Grave, its sequel I Spit on Your Grave: Deja Vu, and the documentary Growing Up with I Spit on Your Grave are each packaged in individual Blu-ray cases housed inside a slipcase with art by Adam Stothard.

I Spit on Your Grave is a 1978 exploitation film written and directed by Meir Zarchi and starring Camille Keaton. Zarchi and Keaton reunited for 2019’s direct sequel, I Spit on Your Grave: Deja Vu, which co-stars Jamie Bernadette and Maria Olsen. Also released in 2019, Growing Up with I Spit on Your Grave is a documentary from Zarchi’s son, Terry Zarchi.

The set also includes I Spit on Your Grave and Deja Vu fold-out 16x20 posters, I Spit on Your Grave and Deja Vu VHS-style magnets, and a 44-page book featuring liner notes by journalists Michael Gingold and Meagan Navarro.

I Spit on Your Grave has been newly scanned in 4K from Zarchi’s uncut 35mm original camera negative with DTS-HD Master Mono and DTS-HD 5.1 audio options. It features reversible artwork with its original title, Day of the Woman.

Special features and additional details can be found below.

Disc 1: I Spit on Your Grave:

Audio commentary by writer/director Meir Zarchi

Audio commentary by film critic Joe Bob Briggs

I Spit on Your Grave filming locations featurette hosted by jouranlist Michael Gingold (new)

The Value of Vengeance - Director Meir Zarchi Remembers I Spit on Your Grave

Day of the Woman alternate opening title sequence

Theatrical trailers

TV & radio spots

Behind-the-scenes photo gallery (new)

Still gallery

Disc 2: I Spit on Your Grave: Deja Vu:

Audio commentary by film critic Joe Bob Briggs

Cast interviews (new)

The Making of I Spit on Your Grave: Deja Vu

Behind-the-scenes footage

Theatrical trailers

Disc 3: Growing Up with I Spit on Your Grave

Deleted scenes

Terry Zarchi’s 8mm film starring Camille Keaton (new)

Meir Zarchi and Camille Keaton wedding footage (new)

Trailer

In 1978, one film changed the face of cinema forever: I Spit on Your Grave. Camille Keaton stars as Jennifer Hills, a young and beautiful career woman who rents a back-woods cabin to write her first novel. Attacked by a group of local lowlifes and left for dead, she devises a horrific plan to inflict revenge in some of the most unforgettable scenes on film.

42 years later, the sequel, I Spit on Your Grave: Deja Vu, sends successful writer Jennifer Hills (Camille Keaton) back to where it all began to face the wrath of the families of those she left for dead. Kidnapped along with her daughter Christy (Jamie Bernadette), it’s a tense game of hunt or be hunted against a ruthless gang of degenerates overseen by a violently unhinged matriarch Becky (Maria Olsen).

Growing Up with I Spit on Your Grave is an exhaustive analysis of the film’s history directed by Meir Zarchi’s son, Terry Zarchi. This feature-length documentary is what every I Spit on Your Grave fan has been waiting for!
